data.title: Santa Maria, California (CA) ~ population data, races, housing & economy
data.text:
Population 2005: 84,346

Population 2004: 83,188

Population 2003: 81,374

Population 2002: 79,375

Population 2001: 78,140

Population 2000: 77,423 (2000 Census)

Population 1990: 61,284 (1990 Census)

Population Growth 2000 to 2005: 8.94%

Population Growth 1990 to 2000: 26.33%

Population (2005 Estimate): 88,817

Male: 46,638 (52.51%)

Female: 42,179 (47.49%)

Median age: 27.90 years

Races, 2005 Data (% change from 2000):

Hispanic or Latino: 64.76% (+5.09%)

White: 27.76% (-4.20%)

Other race: 12.00% (-16.02%)

Asian: 4.22% (-0.52%)

Black or African American: 1.91% (+0.04%)

Two or more races: 1.75% (-3.61%)

American Indian: 0.35% (-1.41%)

Native Hawaiian / Other Pacific Islander: 0.07% (-0.11%)

Housing Units: 22,847 (2000 Census)

Land Area: 19.3276 square miles

Water Area: 0.4420 square miles
